member.name: T:Upbit.Net.ExtensionMethods.UpbitExtensionMethods

member.name: T:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitRestClient
member.summary: Client for accessing the Upbit Rest API.

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitRestClient.SetOptions(CryptoExchange.Net.Objects.Options.UpdateOptions)
member.param: Options to update. Only specific options are changeable after the client has been created

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitRestClient.SetApiCredentials(CryptoExchange.Net.Authentication.ApiCredentials)
member.summary: Set the API credentials for this client. All Api clients in this client will use the new credentials, regardless of earlier set options.

member.name: T:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitSocketClient
member.summary: Client for accessing the Upbit websocket API

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitSocketClient.SetApiCredentials(CryptoExchange.Net.Authentication.ApiCredentials)
member.summary: Set the API credentials for this client. All Api clients in this client will use the new credentials, regardless of earlier set options.

member.name: T:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitUserClientProvider
member.summary: Provider for clients with credentials for specific users

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitUserClientProvider.InitializeUserClient(System.String,CryptoExchange.Net.Authentication.ApiCredentials,Upbit.Net.UpbitEnvironment)
member.summary: Initialize a client for the specified user identifier. This can be used so to initialize a client for a user so ApiCredentials do not need to be passed later.

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitUserClientProvider.ClearUserClients(System.String)
member.summary: Reset the cached clients for a user. This can be useful when a user changes API credentials.

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitUserClientProvider.GetRestClient(System.String,CryptoExchange.Net.Authentication.ApiCredentials,Upbit.Net.UpbitEnvironment)
member.summary: Get the Rest client for a specific user. In case the client does not exist yet it will be created and the should be provided, unless has been called prior for this user.
member.param: The credentials for the user. Required the first time a client is requested for this user unless has been called prior for this user.

member.name: M:Upbit.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IUpbitUserClientProvider.GetSocketClient(System.String,CryptoExchange.Net.Authentication.ApiCredentials,Upbit.Net.UpbitEnvironment)
member.summary: Get the Socket client for a specific user. In case the client does not exist yet it will be created and the should be provided, unless has been called prior for this user.
member.param: The credentials for the user. Required the first time a client is requested for this user unless has been called prior for this user.

member.param: The symbol to subscribe, for example `KRW-ETH`
The event handler for the received data
Cancellation token for closing this subscription
member.returns: A stream subscription. This stream subscription can be used to be notified when the socket is disconnected/reconnected

member.name: P:Upbit.Net.Objects.Options.UpbitOrderBookOptions.Limit
member.summary: The top amount of results to keep in sync. If for example limit=10 is used, the order book will contain the 10 best bids and 10 best asks. Leaving this null will sync the full order book

member.name: P:Upbit.Net.Objects.Options.UpbitOrderBookOptions.InitialDataTimeout
member.summary: After how much time we should consider the connection dropped if no data is received for this time after the initial subscriptions

member.name: P:Upbit.Net.Objects.Options.UpbitSocketOptions.SubscribeMaxWaitForError
member.summary: The server only replies with a message when there is an error in the subscription, not when it's successful. This timeout determines how long to wait at max for an error message before the subscription is assumed successful. Note that when data is received on the subscription before this timeout it is also deemed successful

member.param: Service provider for resolving logging and clients

member.name: T:Upbit.Net.SymbolOrderBooks.UpbitSpotSymbolOrderBook
member.summary: Implementation for a synchronized order book. After calling Start the order book will sync itself and keep up to date with new data. It will automatically try to reconnect and resync in case of a lost/interrupted connection. Make sure to check the State property to see if the order book is synced.
